name: Object Oriented Python
subtitle: Coding the way the cool kids do
description: In this series, Vonne and Justin explore the intricate world of Object-Oriented Programming(OOP), particularly in the context of the Python programming language. Starting with the basics of OOP, Justin demonstrates the creation of classes and associated objects from those classes. Moreover, Justin demonstrates the use of Inheritance of classes to reduce code repetitiveness in an effort to adhere to the Don't Repeat Yourself (DRY) principle. Lastly, Justin builds a simple OOP centric text-based adventure. If you are ready to get into Object-Oriented Python, then join us!
descriptionMD: In this series, Vonne and Justin explore the intricate world of Object-Oriented Programming(OOP), particularly in the context of the Python programming language. Starting with the basics of OOP, Justin demonstrates the creation of classes and associated objects from those classes. Moreover, Justin demonstrates the use of Inheritance of classes to reduce code repetitiveness in an effort to adhere to the Don't Repeat Yourself (DRY) principle. Lastly, Justin builds a simple OOP centric text-based adventure. If you are ready to get into Object-Oriented Python, then join us!

episodes.title: Overview
episodes.description: In this series, Vonne and Justin explore the intricate world of Object-Oriented Programming(OOP), particularly in the context of the Python programming language. Starting with the basics of OOP, Justin demonstrates the creation of classes and associated objects from those classes. Moreover, Justin demonstrates the use of Inheritance of classes to reduce code repetitiveness in an effort to adhere to the Don't Repeat Yourself (DRY) principle. Lastly, Justin builds a simple OOP centric text-based adventure. If you are ready to get into Object-Oriented Python, then join us!

episodes.title: Installation and Setup
episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Justin cover the basics of getting started in Object-Oriented Python. They cover topics such as the current version of Python, types of text editors and IDEs to edit code, and testing in the REPL.

episodes.title: What is Object Oriented Programming
episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Justin review the basic principles of Object-Oriented Programming: encapsulation, abstraction, inheritance, and polymorphism.  These principles will be demonstrated and referred to throughout the series.

episodes.title: Creating Classes and Objects in Python
episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Justin discuss creating classes and objects. In addition, they cover adding methods to those objects as well as things to consider when using these features in Object-Oriented Python.

episodes.title: Extending Classes
episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Justin discuss extending classes and demonstrate both single and multiple inheritance.

episodes.title: Extending Classes Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Justin continue extending classes and multiple inheritance.  They also cover the topic of composition - demonstrating why this principle is favored as best practice.

episodes.title: Lets Build It MonsterSlash v.1
episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Justin build a simple text based game called MonsterSlash using Object-Oriented Python. They cover the game design and establish the actors in the game â€“ the player and the enemy.

episodes.title: Lets Build It MonsterSlash v.1 Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Justin jump back in to building their MonsterSlash game using Object-Oriented Python. They cover how the player can engage the enemy and win!

episodes.title: MonsterSlash v.1 Game Refactor
episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Justin refine the game code in the MonsterSlash game using Object-Oriented Python. They cover making the code cleaner and more efficient as well as extending some of the aspects of the game.

episodes.title: MonsterSlash v.1 Actor Refactor
episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Justin refine the actor code in the MonsterSlash game using Object-Oriented Python. They cover making the code cleaner and more efficient as well as extending some of the aspects of the player and the enemy.

episodes.title: MonsterSlash v.2 Enemies Attack
episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Justin are back with version 2 of the MonsterSlash game using Object-Oriented Python by expanding the characteristics of the actors and the game.

episodes.title: MonsterSlash v.2 Enemies Attack Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Justin finish up with some final touches of version 2 of the MonsterSlash game using Object-Oriented Python.
